The bucket of rubble is a quest item made by the player during the In Aid of the Myreque quest. It is made by mining the rubble using a pickaxe in the basement of the bar in Burgh de Rott, and then using a spade or a pot on the remaining bits of rubble with a bucket in the player's inventory. To empty it, players either have to empty it next to the rubble pile outside the bar, or anywhere outside Burgh de Rott. It has no use after the quest.

There are 15 rubble rocks in the basement and a single bucket can hold three bits of rubble, meaning it will take 5 buckets filled in total to clear all of the rubble.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Despite being able to fill a bucket of rubble three times, a partially filled bucket weighs the same as a totally filled bucket.

The '''bucket of rubble''' is a quest item made by the player during the [[In Aid of the Myreque]] quest. It is made by mining the rubble using a [[pickaxe]] in the basement of the bar in [[Burgh de Rott]], and then using a spade or a pot on the remaining bits of rubble with a bucket in the player's inventory. To empty it, players either have to empty it next to the rubble pile outside the bar, or anywhere outside Burgh de Rott. It has no use after the quest.

There are 15 rubble rocks in the basement and a single bucket can hold three bits of rubble, meaning it will take 5 buckets filled in total to clear all of the rubble.

==Trivia==
*Despite being able to fill a bucket of rubble three times, a partially filled bucket weighs the same as a totally filled bucket.
